author: costin
msg: "Automatic" configuration for tomcat. Any war file in webapps/ will be
automatically expanded and added to contexts. Any directory in webapps
will be automatically added too.
It's not completed - need to figure an encoding to allow deeper paths
( now the name of the war/directory will be the name of the path).
Also, it would be nice to have the install path in web.xml, but that's a spec
problem.
Right now you shouldn't need to touch server.xml unless you want to do
advanced settings.
Deploy == cp WarFile.war tomcat/webapps/path.war
( or create a directory in webapps/ and set up your application
inside)
Remove == rm -rf tomcat/webapps/path tomcat/webapps/path.war
No dependency check is done - if both directory and war exists, directory will
be used ( Q: should we remove the war after expand and if a war file is found,
assume it's update? )
Also:
- Moved "default" settings for ContextManager in interceptor
( it can be replaced by improved versions - config using JNDI, etc)
- Made ResponseImpl cookies available - thanks Ana von Klopp

author: costin
msg: Another big change - use the new Tomcat starter ( still using server.xml )
This change is required in order to allow adding of new "modules"
( interceptors, adapters, etc) at config time, and uses ant-like
"patterns" to configure independent components. It is not final,
but it's better to do the move now in order to "burn" it and to
allow development of adapters. ( and also get feedback on the
"hierarchy" patterns - which is an extension to ant )
Note that stoping tomcat is done using one of the existing adapters
( Ajp12), which has a "stop" command inside (used by Apache to
restart jserv). We will add RMI later,
after more admin methods will be added ( that also mean you need
to start ajp12 instead of RMI !). It no longer use a log file,
but you need to specify the same server.xml when you start and
stop.
Again - it probably brake something, but that's good because we'll
get a chance to fix it, and we can discover more things to do!
